balance is kept in `pocket` instead of this contract.A few assumptions are made:      1. There are no other urns for the same `ilk`      2. Stability fee is always zero for the `ilk`      3. The `spot` price for gem is always 1 (`10**27`).      4. The `spotter.par` (Kusd parity) is always 1 (`10**27`).      5. This contract can freely transfer `gem` on behalf of `pocket`.","events":{"BuyGem(address,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"fee":"The fee in Kusd paid by the user. params.gemAmt: The amount of gem to buy. [`gem` precision].
params.usr: The destination of the bought gems.

returns.kusdInWad: The amount of Kusd required to sell.

buyGemNoFee(address,uint256).details: Only users whitelisted through `kiss()` can call this function.      Reverts if `tout` is set to `HALTED`.

params.gemAmt: The amount of gem to buy. [`gem` precision].
params.usr: The destination of the bought gems.

returns.kusdInWad: The amount of Kusd required to sell.

returns.wad: The amount added to the surplus buffer.

params.gem_: The gem to exchange with Kusd.

cut().details: To keep `_sellGem` gas usage low, it allows users to take pre-minted Kusd up to the whole balance, regardless      if part of it consist of collected fees.      If there is not enough balance, it will need to wait for new pre-minted Kusd to be generated or Kusd swapped      back to complete the withdrawal of fees.

params.data: The new value of the parameter.

file(bytes32,uint256).details: Swapping fees may not apply due to rounding errors for small swaps where      `gemAmt < 10**gem.decimals() / tin` or      `gemAmt < 10**gem.decimals() / tout`.Setting `tin` or `tout` to `HALTED` effectively disables selling and buying gems respectively.

params.data: The new value of the parameter.

fill().details: Both `buf`, the local and global debt ceilings limit the actual minted amount.      Notice that `gem` donations or extraneous debt repayments can also affect the amount.

gemJoin().details: LitePsm does not have an external gem join. All logic is handled internally.      This function is required because there are some dependencies that assume every PSM has a gem join.

returns._0: Whether the contract is live or not.

params.gemAmt: The amount of gem to sell. [`gem` precision].
params.usr: The destination of the bought Kusd.

sellGemNoFee(address,uint256).details: Only users whitelisted through `kiss()` can call this function.      Reverts if `tin` is set to `HALTED`.

params.gemAmt: The amount of gem to sell. [`gem` precision].
params.usr: The destination of the bought Kusd.

trim().details: The total outstanding debt can still be larger than the debt ceiling after `trim`.      Additional `buyGem` calls will enable further `trim` calls.

HALTED().notice: Special value for `tin` and/or `tout` to indicate swaps are halted.

bud(address).notice: Addresses with permission to swap with no fees. `bud[usr]`.

buyGemNoFee(address,uint256).notice: Function that swaps Kusd into `gem` without any fees.

chug().notice: Incorporates any outstanding accumulated fees into the surplus buffer.

cut().notice: Returns the amount of swapping fees that can be chugged by this contract.

dec().notice: Returns the number of decimals for `gem`.

deny(address).notice: Revokes `usr` admin access from this contract.

diss(address).notice: Revokes `usr` permission to swap without any fees.

gemJoin().notice: Returns the address of the LitePsm contract itself.

gush().notice: Returns the excess Kusd that can be trimmed from this contract.

kiss(address).notice: Grants `usr` permission to swap without any fees.

live().notice: Returns whether the contract is live or not.

pocket().notice: The ultimate holder of the gems.

rely(address).notice: Grants `usr` admin access to this contract.

rush().notice: Returns the missing Kusd that can be filled into this contract.

sellGemNoFee(address,uint256).notice: Function that swaps `gem` into Kusd without any fees.

to18ConversionFactor().notice: Precision conversion factor for `gem`, since Kusd is expected to always have 18 decimals.

trim().notice: Burns any excess of Kusd from this contract.

wards(address).notice: Addresses with admin access on this contract. `wards[usr]`.
